competitors.name: Databricks
competitors.notes: Primary competitor with unified lakehouse platform, strong in ML/AI workloads

competitors.name: Amazon Redshift
competitors.notes: Leading AWS cloud data warehouse, strong for AWS-committed organizations

competitors.name: Google BigQuery
competitors.notes: Serverless data warehouse with pay-per-query model

competitors.name: Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics
competitors.notes: Unified analytics platform combining data warehousing and big data

competitors.name: ClickHouse
competitors.notes: Open-source columnar database for real-time analytics

competitors.name: Firebolt
competitors.notes: Cloud data warehouse focused on extreme query performance

competitors.name: Dremio
competitors.notes: Data lakehouse platform with semantic layer capabilities

competitors.name: Amazon Athena
competitors.notes: Serverless query service for S3 data

competitors.name: Trino
competitors.notes: Distributed SQL query engine for big data analytics

competitors.name: SingleStore
competitors.notes: Real-time distributed database for transactions and analytics

competitors.name: Teradata
competitors.notes: Enterprise data warehouse with cloud offerings

context: By 2024, the cloud data warehouse market matured significantly with Snowflake and Databricks as leading multi-cloud platforms. The landscape diversified with new challengers in real-time analytics (ClickHouse), extreme performance (Firebolt), and open-source alternatives (Trino, DuckDB).
